verses.kjv: Therefore, my brethren dearly beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand fast in the Lord, my dearly beloved.
verses.ct: So then, my dear brothers and sisters whom I love and miss so much, you who are my joy and my crown — stand firm in the Lord, my dear ones.

verses.kjv: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.
verses.ct: I urge Euodias and I urge Syntyche to come to agreement with each other in the Lord.

verses.kjv: And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and with other my fellowlabourers, whose names are in the book of life.
verses.ct: And I also ask you, my true partner, to help these women who worked hard alongside me in spreading the gospel, together with Clement and the rest of my coworkers, whose names are written in the book of life.

verses.kjv: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
verses.ct: Always find your joy in the Lord. Let me say it once more: find your joy in him!

verses.kjv: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand.
verses.ct: Let everyone see your gentleness. The Lord is near.

verses.kjv: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
verses.ct: Don't be anxious about anything. Instead, in every situation, bring your requests to God through prayer and heartfelt asking, along with thankfulness.

verses.kjv: And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: Then God's peace, which goes beyond anything we can comprehend, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things.
verses.ct: Finally, brothers and sisters, focus your thoughts on whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is right, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is admirable — if something is excellent or worthy of praise, dwell on it.

verses.kjv: Those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, do: and the God of peace shall be with you.
verses.ct: Put into practice everything you have learned, received, heard, and observed in me. And the God of peace will be with you.

verses.kjv: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly, that now at the last your care of me hath flourished again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye lacked opportunity.
verses.ct: I was overjoyed in the Lord that at last you renewed your concern for me. You had always cared, of course, but you simply didn't have the chance to show it.

verses.kjv: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content.
verses.ct: I'm not saying this because I'm in need, since I've learned to be satisfied in whatever circumstances I find myself.

verses.kjv: I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every where and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.
verses.ct: I know what it's like to go without, and I know what it's like to have plenty. In every situation, I've discovered the secret of being well-fed or going hungry, of having abundance or facing shortage.

verses.kjv: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.ct: I am able to handle anything through Christ, who gives me strength.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.
verses.ct: Even so, it was good of you to share in my difficulties.

verses.kjv: Now ye Philippians know also, that in the beginning of the gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no church communicated with me as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only.
verses.ct: You Philippians yourselves know that in the early days of the gospel, when I left Macedonia, no other church partnered with me in giving and receiving except you alone.

verses.kjv: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.
verses.ct: Even while I was in Thessalonica, you sent help for my needs more than once.

verses.kjv: Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.
verses.ct: It's not that I'm looking for a gift from you. What I really want is for the credit to keep growing in your account.

verses.kjv: But I have all, and abound: I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, wellpleasing to God.
verses.ct: I have everything I need and more than enough. I am fully supplied now that I've received your gifts through Epaphroditus — a fragrant offering, a sacrifice that is acceptable and pleasing to God.

verses.kjv: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: And my God will meet every one of your needs out of his glorious riches in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.ct: To our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.

verses.kjv: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.
verses.ct: Give my greetings to every one of God's people in Christ Jesus. The brothers and sisters here with me send their greetings to you.

verses.kjv: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Caesar’s household.
verses.ct: All of God's people here send you their greetings, especially those who serve in Caesar's household.

verses.kjv: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verses.ct: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.
